benchmark_details.name: GECOBench: A Gender-Controlled Text Dataset and Benchmark for Quantifying Biases in Explanations
benchmark_details.overview: GECO is a gender-controlled text dataset designed for the development and evaluation of XAI methods. GECOBench is a quantitative benchmarking framework to assess the correctness of machine learning world explanations for language models on gender classification tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a rigorous open framework for benchmarking the correctness of explanations of pre-trained language models and aspects of fairness.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark does not consider non-linear feature interactions present in many real-world applications.

data.source: Sentences sourced from Wikipedia pages of popular books with gender manipulation to create male and female sentence variants.
data.annotation: Manual labeling of gender for subjects and other protagonist words in sentences.

methodology.calculation: Mass Accuracy is calculated by determining the correctness of explanations against ground truth based on token importance.
methodology.interpretation: A perfect Mass Accuracy score indicates that only ground truth tokens are recognized as important.
methodology.validation: Validations were conducted by manual checking of explanations against ground truth data.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Yes, the dataset was created to be gender-balanced.
